title: Installation Trouble...
body:
I ended up being plagued by dnsunlocker. I sent my laptop to the repair shop and sure they did a good job but, I still had the dnsunlocker. I did everything I could with the information I found online but, even after all that it kept coming back. So, I blew up and in a rage induced haze I did a pc reset. It was gone and everything seemed fine. I downloaded/reinstalled my online games. I have no issues from everything I usually do on my laptop. This happened 3 weeks ago.

Yesterday, I decided I wanted to start playing League again after over 2 years of taking off from League. I downloaded/installed League, Adobe Air, Directx, and when that was done I opened the launcher to start downloading more. It closed the launcher and said PVP.net Patcher Kernel has stopped working. So, I dug around League posts to see if there was a solution to this. Yes, I have tried to run as administrator.

I just don't know what to do since, I am not tech savvy. Did my pc reset remove something that is needed to play League? I have no issues with my other online games. A solution to my dilemma would be much appreciated.

replies.body: It looks like your OS is blocking the patcher from scanning files and preventing the game from launching.  The permission steps that Rineey provided should resolve this.  If you are still having an issue, please [submit a ticket ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new)and our tech team will be more than happy to help you out further.  Thanks for your patience, hopefully we can get you back in game soon!
I've done the instructions in that link and gave the launcher so much permission, it still ends with the same result. I don't understand.

Got to your Riot Games folder (typically located in C: > Riot Games > League of Legends > lol.launcher.admin

If that doesn't work; 

1. Open Task Manager.
2. Click on "Processes"
3. Find "rads_user_kernel.exe".
4. Right-click on it and go to Properties.
5. Go to compatibility.
6. Set Privilege Level to "Run this program as an administrator".
7. "Apply" and leave the screen.
8. Run the game again.

That also did not work for me. I am starting to think this is a more intricate problem because of my pc reset, that isn't linked to just running the program as an administrator. Otherwise, the assistance you guys offered should have worked.
Have you submitted a ticket as Porocles mentioned?
Yes I have and found my main account while finding the info to fill out the form. 2 years+ and I forget what is what... xD
